Leaving here again a thank you message for @Andreas S. who introduced me to Kernel and pinged me at the right time to not forget the deadline :relaxed: Also thank you to @alisha for a great interview! :pray::seedling::sunflower:

:clap: I :clap: also :clap: just :clap: want :clap: to :clap: simp :clap: for :clap: future :clap: @alisha :clap:

Alisha is why I’m here! Was sort of on the fence about this program til I met her: she’s amazing! All the :fire: for Alisha!!!
Second that! @alisha you are a wonderful person.

A gift of deep gratitude for friends old and new, for all that has been shared to honour our time together :pray:

<https://kernel.community/en/conversation/true-voice/>

cc @Harold Davis @Sparrow Read @Sebnem @Abe Uccello @Holly Grimm @Matthew Stephenson @Muhammad Hameed @Tagan Horton @alisha @Ellena Rapaport @Anna Alexa @Rebecca Mqamelo and the many others who will hopefully continue to grow this conversation over many, many years :heart:

Truly grateful to have been part of this journey. The past 8 weeks have been quite memorable for me. The conversations, the lessons, the people, everything that makes KERNEL "KERNEL" came together and made it wonderful. Not enough can be said to thank all the Stewards who paved this entire block @Vivek Singh @Angela Gilhotra @Sachin Mittal @cryptowanderer @johnx25bd and everyone else involved! This experience was a gift, and I am glad I was one of the few lucky ones to be able to receive it so far.

Thanks to all the mentors and guests who took time off their hectic days to talk to us Fellows, and guide us through our journey. The juntos, fireside, KERNEL Cafe, One-to-one Offerings, etc. was just beautiful. I am glad I was able to speak with many of you in <!subteam^S0224NELPGD|@kb3> and I hope we keep the ties strong. I love how everyone in this group is either building something or looking for inspiration to start. I love what everyone is working on, and I wish everyone the best in their journeys from here on.

Lots of gratitude and love to you all!
Special shoutouts to @Paulo Almeida @Serg Lotz @Rahul // r-nk.xyz @Leo Lara @Rev Miller @En Canada @Tagan Horton @stickykeys @Sebastian T F @Aiswarya Walter @alisha and everyone else whom I've met in KERNEL, and had conversations with.



:v::kernel-love::musical_note:  to all!

BIG gratitude to everyone who joined the Powerful Visionary Women call yesterday - @Naureen N @alisha @Zeena A. @Claudie Linke @Angela Gilhotra @Rachel H @Bianca Trovo @Kelly Nash @Alexandra McCarroll @Aiswarya Walter :rainbowheart:

Here's to an amazing pluri-perspective present & future

I am grateful for @alisha for asking better questions and listening. She inspires me plus she loves tea. Support her and her podcast, <https://gitcoin.co/grants/2908/crypto-native-video-podcast-with-future-alisha|CryptoNative> :kernel-love:

I would like to express my gratitude to @Carmen, @alisha, @Ciaran Moore and @Rachel H for an amazing junto session last friday ! The ideas that resounded around the space were truly inspiring and really helped me in the direction of understanding what social movement could be within web3 .
I am working on a document with the ideas discussed what I will share here , and following one of the questions proposed (Who should we bring to blockchain that isn't here yet ?) , I have invited Marc Streit to join us for a talk . Marc is a swiss dance curator that has been a driving force for Zurichs queer alternative and underground performance scene, having curated Zurich Moves for the last 7 years ! This is part of the idea of my Junto, to bring speakers from different artistic and production contexts and understand from the experienced voice what is at fault in the systems we have available right now, so that we can better them, if not totally changing them :heart:
and some food for thought on this sunday :heart: <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Body_without_organs>

Just had one and a half hour long wonderful chat with @alisha about all things KERNEL, Web3 and beyond. Such a great conversation! Very grateful for KERNEL to making this connection possible! :kernel-love:

Leaving here again a thank you message for @Andreas S. who introduced me to Kernel and pinged me at the right time to not forget the deadline :relaxed: Also thank you to @alisha for a great interview! :pray::seedling::sunflower:

Greatful  so much  all the members i met in the airmeet table sessions :
1. @Sudhanshu Mishra  for lucidly explaining the work @sequoia  ,  giving good insights in the factors for  the startups for investing in the  Dapp  based startup , and patiently listening to the ideas  of the other participants and giving good critical feedbacks   .
2.  @Stefania Barbaglio: for sharing her idea for healthcare services on the blockchain. 
3. @Prashant Maurya :  For giving the good insight on his project  for  blockchain hosting and storage ( in fact i will be hosting junto on that next week , feel free to register)
 4.  @Naureen N  and @johnx25bd for getting in touch with likeminded cohorts.

5. @Muhammad Hameed for sharing his adventure which aligns with my idea for attesting the quality of 3d printed  artifacts in digital NFT space for NGO's and social causes .
and @Thomas for the great discussion in the NFT space .

Thank you to @Vivek Singh @Ben Lakoff @Praneeth Srikanti @Carra Wu for the pep talks, I needed it badly, hope I didn’t take up too much space! Kudos @Sister Tibebwa - who is so inspiring and grounding me and giving me so much insight on how I can structure a DAO in the Filipinx American community (related to my non-profit eventually)  and tie it back to environmental justice, fighting climate change in the Philippines. Super impressed with everyone I saw at Expo, from @Andros Wong @CJ Hetherington @Richard Blythman @Hithesh Shaji @Kevin Seagraves @Filipe Macedo @Andreas Vilela @Pedro Oliveira @Anuj Kumar Kodam @Amarnath Jayanti @gwendall. You all raise the bar so high and it is making me want to do so much more grounded in good principles. I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

@Greg Becker you did it again :slightly_smiling_face:
What a blockbook, @Ben PercifieldTO, my partner in zoom trooping!

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

Now at the end of KERNEL, not only I learnt so much about Web3, I went on an adventure with a wonderful team and made a beautiful prototype and working on a potentially world-changing idea. Thank you @Nate Jacobs and @Martin Etzrodt  and @Eddy Schauman-Haigh @Bolo Michelin @Amir Jabarivasal , also many others who have supported us along the way, particularly  @Brent Annells  and @Anuj Kumar Kodam for your generous connection and advice, and the wonderfully eloquent , generous and wise @cryptowanderer.  Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you to @Vivek Singh @Ben Lakoff @Praneeth Srikanti @Carra Wu for the pep talks, I needed it badly, hope I didn’t take up too much space! Kudos @Sister Tibebwa - who is so inspiring and grounding me and giving me so much insight on how I can structure a DAO in the Filipinx American community (related to my non-profit eventually)  and tie it back to environmental justice, fighting climate change in the Philippines. Super impressed with everyone I saw at Expo, from @Andros Wong @CJ Hetherington @Richard Blythman @Hithesh Shaji @Kevin Seagraves @Filipe Macedo @Andreas Vilela @Pedro Oliveira @Anuj Kumar Kodam @Amarnath Jayanti @gwendall. You all raise the bar so high and it is making me want to do so much more grounded in good principles. I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

So much gratitude for the opportunity to share a story in last weeks kernel junto. I cried, again. It's an amazing empowering feeling to have a context within which to tell some small but deeply meaningful part of my lifestory without feeling openly critisied or judged. @Tommy Nienchi Chen for an opening to share my 'freedom of choice' within a direct context:seedling: @Anuj Kumar Kodam your support meant the world to me thank you, thank you for seeing courage where so many others would see failure/stubborness/stupidity :heart: @cryptowanderer for sharing your story which in stark contrast to my freedom, helps as always build perspective :peace_symbol: And ghandi's note "my life is my message" - I can highly recommend the autobiography (read after the fact):book: And to my fourth quiet listener, sorry I forget :wave: you guys have no idea how transformative it is to share some truths outside of my family and friends. Love light & blessing to you each XXOO

I so appreciated the conversations in Kernel Office hours with @Vivek Singh @Vienna Looi @Anuj Kumar Kodam earlier today. Right afterward and some cooking, I cancelled an event I was going to work on with a finance association I had some issues with (a lot of them in traditional banking that sort of erked me) for my non-profit, and I felt like I was just a hamster on a wheel, rather than chilling, cooling down, and coming from a very intentional place. Ultimately Kernel overall has challenged me a lot to think highly about quality, to be a better more soulful version of myself. I also appreciate the fact that there is so much attention paid to with artists, poetry, and things that make me feel human again, many things that I have felt are never shared in other spaces I traversed from the get-go the last 7 years (AR VR AI in particular), and being human-centric in mind in that regard. I feel very nourished and rejuvenated. While I have a lot on my plate, I also want to +1 what Vivek said about ‘double majoring and minoring’ while I try to get a way with showcasing I wish 3 ventures next week at Expo, I’ll really limit it to 1-2 so I can showcase quality to the rest of the Kernel community. Thank you for our amazing conversation today, I learned so much through osmosis being in the space with you all!

<https://mirror.xyz/0x7BfE90590179A586080682f149d106b70cb51E3E/NOenCnVzH-Wx8eYMf81z0HYKlED-9HeXSzMGwWzENxs>

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."
Thank you for the meditation (cooking @Vienna Looi . Great spending time with you @sidcode @Tian Zhao @Saskia Westhof

received.message: PS I was also super duper excited to see folks I've known for years be apart of this space from day 1 I jumped. #1) My favorite acoustic guitarist I knew from my early college days at UCSC (before transferring to Cal/UC Berkeley), the best person I could find that can sing both Usher “Yeah” and Britney Spears “Toxic” tracks, this universally beautiful and talented artist in so many mediums, @Lani Trock. And #2) one of my fav dev friends, fellow metaverse/spatial computing/XR homie and contributing author to my book, Creating AR VR @Dilan Shah who I've seen grow so much (before YUR, seeing its evolution, and now watching from afar his new take with web3). They have the best data viz hands down and Dilan is a pioneer in this space so I just wanted to shout him out and given him some love.

received.message: PS I was also super duper excited to see folks I've known for years be apart of this space from day 1 I jumped. #1) My favorite acoustic guitarist I knew from my early college days at UCSC (before transferring to Cal/UC Berkeley), the best person I could find that can sing both Usher “Yeah” and Britney Spears “Toxic” tracks, this universally beautiful and talented artist in so many mediums, @Lani Trock. And #2) one of my fav dev friends, fellow metaverse/spatial computing/XR homie and contributing author to my book, Creating AR VR @Dilan Shah who I've seen grow so much (before YUR, seeing its evolution, and now watching from afar his new take with web3). They have the best data viz hands down and Dilan is a pioneer in this space so I just wanted to shout him out and given him some love.

44847777523747544.name: Ela
44847777523747544.testimonial: Ela -- thank you for being with us for KB4. Your energy and your intelligence brought infinite gifts to the space, and we are more hopeful for Web3 given the work you do and who you are.

received.message: Had a nice call with @Ela this morning where she taught me some Discord tips for how she made such an amazing setup for SURGE. Now back to wrestling with bots and channel settings in a test server to get that smooth onboarding experience they have! :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you!!

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> for bringing in such wonderful people and creating this high trust space for magic to happen. :pray::kernel-love::shamrock::rainbow::heart::pray:

21314029218047470.name: Tim Courtney
21314029218047470.testimonial: Tim, thank you for your sincerity, your clarity, your open-mindedness and your kindness. We truly value you and want you to have this token of our appreciation for safe-keeping: https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poetrymagazine/poems/52727/the-great-order-of-the-universe

received.message:
Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

So thankful for the Fireside talk today and thankful to talk with @Sylvia R @Tim Courtney @Filip Masar and @En Canada in Gathertown. Today fireside actually touched my heart and answers alot of questions about Self.

@Songyi Lee @Tim Courtney @snax y-not all for points on curation vs. volume discussion and thoughts on DAOs modeled as libraries / supportive of different personal hobbies. Tim shared this in conjunction with the topic of Gore having innovation in democracy: <https://www.managementexchange.com/story/innovation-democracy-wl-gores-original-management-model#:~:text=As%20Gore%20has%[>…]no%20management%20layers @sumedha for organizing

I am so thankful!

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

A huge thank you to @Richard Blythman for the work he is doing on Algovera, which has been running as a recurring Kernel junto and is now its own guild (much like @Michael Keating's wonderful work with the tokenaughts): <https://kernel.community/en/build/decentralized-ai/>

If you're into either decentralizing AI, or tokenomics, or both - make sure to check out all the new resources on our build pages thanks to these wonderful people :kernel-love:
I thoroughly enjoyed the decentralized AI Zoom you held yesterday @Richard Blythman. Will continue speaking here and your Discord channel. :heart: all that you’re doing.

Thank you to @Vivek Singh @Ben Lakoff @Praneeth Srikanti @Carra Wu for the pep talks, I needed it badly, hope I didn’t take up too much space! Kudos @Sister Tibebwa - who is so inspiring and grounding me and giving me so much insight on how I can structure a DAO in the Filipinx American community (related to my non-profit eventually)  and tie it back to environmental justice, fighting climate change in the Philippines. Super impressed with everyone I saw at Expo, from @Andros Wong @CJ Hetherington @Richard Blythman @Hithesh Shaji @Kevin Seagraves @Filipe Macedo @Andreas Vilela @Pedro Oliveira @Anuj Kumar Kodam @Amarnath Jayanti @gwendall. You all raise the bar so high and it is making me want to do so much more grounded in good principles. I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

attributes.value: Artistic Intelligence
Richard, thank you so very much for everything you have contributed to kb4: it is an honour and privilege to know you and we look forward to an infinite number of games with you going forward.

received.message: There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

:heart: Very thankful to @Juanna Zhai @Mitzy C @Chase Chapman for bringing up Kernel and encouraging joining Kernel :smiling_face_with_3_hearts: And honestly just for this whole community. Much love to y'all

Feeling blessed to be here and thankful to @Mitzy C & @Juanna Zhai for sharing their stoke! so I could find my way here. Also yay for spring gardening, blossoming fruit trees, my beloved family, spring skiing & daylight savings +13 GMT

:heart: Very thankful to @Juanna Zhai @Mitzy C @Chase Chapman for bringing up Kernel and encouraging joining Kernel :smiling_face_with_3_hearts: And honestly just for this whole community. Much love to y'all

10979004308324472.name: Kelsey Chen
10979004308324472.testimonial:
Being of bonded water
you are bound for peace, 
here and now.

There is no paradox,
contentment arises of itself.
What is neither beyond nor before
breathes life, now here.

One sound, one heart.
Just silence.

received.message:
There is so much to be thankful for :kernel-love:

Today, I wish to offer my sincerest gratitude to @kei for all the work she has done over many years which continually inspires, guides and delights me. Being thus, I have <https://kernel.community/en/learn/module-4/self-enquiry|replaced the old identity piece in Module 4> with another essay mixer based largely on her idea of Inventories, coupled with an essay from Aaron Lewis and a few other hidden gems.

One such hidden gem comes from @Jasmine Wang and is all about <https://kernel-community.slack.com/archives/C01857MHZGT/p1638858113179500|attention>. I heartily suggest you give it some of yours.

Another thread links to @Anna Alexa and @Kelsey Chen, both of whom were kind enough to recommend Braiding Sweetgrass to me, which has <https://kernel.community/en/conversation/reciprocity/|found its way into the syllabus> along with this new piece on inventive interfaces for those who want to trace the reciprocal web of relationships right down into the roots :pray:

You are all incredible and I have so much love for each of you.

Just silence.

I’m excited for @Bianca Aguilar @Vince Trost @Andrew C @Elmo Chong - can’t wait to see what you all do in your next iteration!

received.message: There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

<https://mirror.xyz/0x7BfE90590179A586080682f149d106b70cb51E3E/NOenCnVzH-Wx8eYMf81z0HYKlED-9HeXSzMGwWzENxs>

So much gratitude for the opportunity to share a story in last weeks kernel junto. I cried, again. It's an amazing empowering feeling to have a context within which to tell some small but deeply meaningful part of my lifestory without feeling openly critisied or judged. @Tommy Nienchi Chen for an opening to share my 'freedom of choice' within a direct context:seedling: @Anuj Kumar Kodam your support meant the world to me thank you, thank you for seeing courage where so many others would see failure/stubborness/stupidity :heart: @cryptowanderer for sharing your story which in stark contrast to my freedom, helps as always build perspective :peace_symbol: And ghandi's note "my life is my message" - I can highly recommend the autobiography (read after the fact):book: And to my fourth quiet listener, sorry I forget :wave: you guys have no idea how transformative it is to share some truths outside of my family and friends. Love light & blessing to you each XXOO
Shout out to @Tommy Nienchi Chen for introducing me to the Kernel and encouraging me to apply!

attributes.value: Tommy, thank you so much for all you shared, all the stories you brought, and the way you participated in kb4. It is a privilege to know you.

received.message: Amén @Ayomide I’m all in!  Let’s get these children a fighting chance in life.  I believe that technology will soon be the great equalizer between the rich and the poor.  FREE TECHNOLOGY EDUCATION FOR ALL!

Virtual hug goes to you too @Renee Maria Lee and @Ayomide.  The short Juntos we had was emotionally charged.  I saw both of you shedding some tears and I must admit, I did too. We’ll make this happen!  I invited both of you in a new channel I created and invited some like-minded individuals who might be interested to participate in our journey <#C02L0NW6KJL|aiotmetaversity>

@Ayomide @Romeo Siquijor My heart and hope are just so happy to find you both kindred spirits on the long timeline of youth education and equality. Bring on the animated, gamified metaverse of applied education. I just had to jump up and down like a little kid, I would hug you both! *Anything* I can do to help just hola

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

@Renee Maria Lee @Vienna Looi @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @Michael Keating @Martin Etzrodt @O'Plerou Grebet @Ben Percifield @Erin Pangilinan @sidcode @alisha @Tommy Nienchi Chen @Sister Tibebwa @Ai Tuonoin @Amarnath Jayanti @Bella Dokell @johnx25bd & many more I've met on this journey and yet to meet :pray: deep gratitude and  :heart: love for sharing the space you all did!

received.message: Before starting KERNEL, I knew I wanted to build a dApp but had no idea what to build, how to build and who to build it with. Now at the end of KERNEL, not only I learnt so much about Web3, I went on an adventure with a wonderful team and made a beautiful prototype and working on a potentially world-changing idea. Thank you @Nate Jacobs and @Martin Etzrodt  and @Eddy Schauman-Haigh @Bolo Michelin @Amir Jabarivasal , also many others who have supported us along the way, particularly  @Brent Annells  and @Anuj Kumar Kodam for your generous connection and advice, and the wonderfully eloquent , generous and wise @cryptowanderer.  Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> for bringing in such wonderful people and creating this high trust space for magic to happen. :pray::kernel-love::shamrock::rainbow::heart::pray:

You are an amazing person, we can only be in endless gratitude that you are willing to share that incredible heart with all of us. We look forward to a new kind of ChiPunk and infinitely many more games of meaning and value with you in the years to come.

received.message: There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

@Andros Wong & @Songyi Lee thank you both for your time and patience, as is the nature of reciprocity I feel indebted to you both if ever there's anything I can do, well lets keep in touch :rainbowheart:

@Songyi Lee @Tim Courtney @snax y-not all for points on curation vs. volume discussion and thoughts on DAOs modeled as libraries / supportive of different personal hobbies. Tim shared this in conjunction with the topic of Gore having innovation in democracy: <https://www.managementexchange.com/story/innovation-democracy-wl-gores-original-management-model#:~:text=As%20Gore%20has%[>…]no%20management%20layers @sumedha for organizing

Before starting KERNEL, I knew I wanted to build a dApp but had no idea what to build, how to build and who to build it with. Now at the end of KERNEL, not only I learnt so much about Web3, I went on an adventure with a wonderful team and made a beautiful prototype and working on a potentially world-changing idea. Thank you @Nate Jacobs and @Martin Etzrodt  and @Eddy Schauman-Haigh @Bolo Michelin @Amir Jabarivasal , also many others who have supported us along the way, particularly  @Brent Annells  and @Anuj Kumar Kodam for your generous connection and advice, and the wonderfully eloquent , generous and wise @cryptowanderer.  Now KB4 is ending but my web3 journey has just started. Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> for bringing in such wonderful people and creating this high trust space for magic to happen. :pray::kernel-love::shamrock::rainbow::heart::pray:

Thank you @Brent Annells for being so genuine and for offering your skills/talent in for framing ideas and putting them into clear messages. Thanks for taking your time and interest in learning about Nimbly and helping out! :raised_hands: Eternally grateful :pray:
Big gratitude to @Brent Annells for sharing some amazing idea synthesizing skills. Seriously good stuff!

I am so thankful!

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:
Thank you for organizing such a great convo junto today @Vienna Looi. Loved learning with you and @Holly Grimm. You all have such beautiful minds
Thank you @Vienna Looi for making me remember how great the practice of martial arts feels. My body, mind, and soul are grateful for our last night junto. Great talk. Thank you:pray: :rainbowheart:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

@Renee Maria Lee @Vienna Looi @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @Michael Keating @Martin Etzrodt @O'Plerou Grebet @Ben Percifield @Erin Pangilinan @sidcode @alisha @Tommy Nienchi Chen @Sister Tibebwa @Ai Tuonoin @Amarnath Jayanti @Bella Dokell @johnx25bd & many more I've met on this journey and yet to meet :pray: deep gratitude and  :heart: love for sharing the space you all did!

Here's my love letter to the space we call Kernel, Here's a little love letter to the space we call Kernel. @cryptowanderer I managed to mint it, gas was ok. :smiley:

<https://mirror.xyz/0x7BfE90590179A586080682f149d106b70cb51E3E/NOenCnVzH-Wx8eYMf81z0HYKlED-9HeXSzMGwWzENxs>

I love that you have words for all of this @Vienna Looi  you are so making the difference, right now. Thank you for sharing you wisdom, passion and good reads, still working through the Dawn of Everything and have added Meisers "Justice is an option" to the list.:heart: :exploding_head: :fire:
Thank you for the meditation (cooking @Vienna Looi . Great spending time with you @sidcode @Tian Zhao @Saskia Westhof
Also shout-out to @Vienna Looi who I absolutely also adore :wink:

I so appreciated the conversations in Kernel Office hours with @Vivek Singh @Vienna Looi @Anuj Kumar Kodam earlier today. Right afterward and some cooking, I cancelled an event I was going to work on with a finance association I had some issues with (a lot of them in traditional banking that sort of erked me) for my non-profit, and I felt like I was just a hamster on a wheel, rather than chilling, cooling down, and coming from a very intentional place. Ultimately Kernel overall has challenged me a lot to think highly about quality, to be a better more soulful version of myself. I also appreciate the fact that there is so much attention paid to with artists, poetry, and things that make me feel human again, many things that I have felt are never shared in other spaces I traversed from the get-go the last 7 years (AR VR AI in particular), and being human-centric in mind in that regard. I feel very nourished and rejuvenated. While I have a lot on my plate, I also want to +1 what Vivek said about ‘double majoring and minoring’ while I try to get a way with showcasing I wish 3 ventures next week at Expo, I’ll really limit it to 1-2 so I can showcase quality to the rest of the Kernel community. Thank you for our amazing conversation today, I learned so much through osmosis being in the space with you all!

I am so thankful!

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you @Michael Keating for todays office hours talk. I really appreciate everything you've said to me today, all your questions, advices that you've given me. All of them will help me clarify more what I want and what I will do in a near future. Also thanks to @Amarnath Jayanti @sidcode @snax y-not for listening to my story and giving me your advice. I really needed to hear that. And thanks @Vivek Singh for connecting me with Michael. Kernel is such a great community :kernel-love:

A huge thank you to @Richard Blythman for the work he is doing on Algovera, which has been running as a recurring Kernel junto and is now its own guild (much like @Michael Keating's wonderful work with the tokenaughts): <https://kernel.community/en/build/decentralized-ai/>

If you're into either decentralizing AI, or tokenomics, or both - make sure to check out all the new resources on our build pages thanks to these wonderful people :kernel-love:

I see there's many emotions building in each one of us being expressed in various ways, beautiful to see it all and the journey that we embarked together. If this is just the starting, can't imagine the beauty of the game ahead!

@Renee Maria Lee @Vienna Looi @Sachin Mittal @Vivek Singh @Michael Keating @Martin Etzrodt @O'Plerou Grebet @Ben Percifield @Erin Pangilinan @sidcode @alisha @Tommy Nienchi Chen @Sister Tibebwa @Ai Tuonoin @Amarnath Jayanti @Bella Dokell @johnx25bd & many more I've met on this journey and yet to meet :pray: deep gratitude and  :heart: love for sharing the space you all did!

Here's my love letter to the space we call Kernel, Here's a little love letter to the space we call Kernel. @cryptowanderer I managed to mint it, gas was ok. :smiley:

<https://mirror.xyz/0x7BfE90590179A586080682f149d106b70cb51E3E/NOenCnVzH-Wx8eYMf81z0HYKlED-9HeXSzMGwWzENxs>

Pausing to compile notes from calls with amazing Kernel folks this last week and reflect. So grateful to be in the company of such amazing, thoughtful people. Looking forward to the home stretch and working with y’all ongoing. Thx @Michael Keating @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh @Divine Artis @En Canada and also thanks to everyone who has responded thoughtfully to my questions and prompts this week :slightly_smiling_face: :kernel-love:
Thank you to @alisha @Michael Keating @Artem B. and @Michelle Ma for a great discussion on tokens in our junto breakout room yesterday!
Thank you very much to @Michael Keating for being the spark that ignited the Arweave wildfire talk, and for so gracefully surrendering your junto to two tokenomic nerds :kernel-love:

Grateful to be alive today!

Also big thanks to @Michael Keating @Ben Percifield for taking time out to talk strategy and branding for <http://wall.app|wall.app>
Excited to share with you all what we've been building :bouncingparrot:

attributes.value: The Tokenaught

Michael, we cannot thank you enough for everything you did to make kb4 what it was. From your presence and participation to the tokenomics guild and everything in between: you are truly one of a kind.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

received.message:
There is so much to be thankful for :kernel-love:

Today, I wish to offer my sincerest gratitude to @kei for all the work she has done over many years which continually inspires, guides and delights me. Being thus, I have <https://kernel.community/en/learn/module-4/self-enquiry|replaced the old identity piece in Module 4> with another essay mixer based largely on her idea of Inventories, coupled with an essay from Aaron Lewis and a few other hidden gems.

One such hidden gem comes from @Jasmine Wang and is all about <https://kernel-community.slack.com/archives/C01857MHZGT/p1638858113179500|attention>. I heartily suggest you give it some of yours.

Another thread links to @Anna Alexa and @Kelsey Chen, both of whom were kind enough to recommend Braiding Sweetgrass to me, which has <https://kernel.community/en/conversation/reciprocity/|found its way into the syllabus> along with this new piece on inventive interfaces for those who want to trace the reciprocal web of relationships right down into the roots :pray:

You are all incredible and I have so much love for each of you.

I am so thankful!

There are far too many people to thank but here goes. Thanks for letting me cry in Twitter Spaces today @Vivek Singh @alisha @Angela Gilhotra @cryptowanderer @Sachin Mittal. In KB4, I've bonded, spent time with or been in the presence with these amazingly inspirational womxn of color @Vienna Looi @Songyi Lee @Holly Grimm @Jasmine Wang @Michelle Ma @Denise Schaefer @Rebecca Mqamelo @Juanna Zhai. I've been so moved by the work of @Richard Blythman @Matthew Scott Jones that I hope for the future of the “metaverse” and AI, places where I have felt trapped in centralized recreating inequalities for so long, that it's such a fresh breathe of air to see these amazing founders for their work and I can't wait to see more from them and work with them somehow in some fashion at the intersection as its relevant with my work in the future. I have an extremely long list of all the folks who demo’ed today at Showcase and Expo that I either plan on somehow integrating into in my future work (be a user, beta tester, adviser on their platform). Thank you (Salamat) again to @Alex Yao Lisa Lee Lucas (co-founder of NOVA with @Nicolas Nicolas Ponette) and Michelle Tsing (laptopradio and blockchain adviser to some companies out of Kernel and Blockchain at Berkeley accelerator) for pushing me to apply. I almost didn't and I am so glad I did. It is really encouraging me to do all the things I want to with DAOs, to not compromise my values, and stay true to myself, in a world obsessed with performative isms that is the Hollywood/Silicon Valley/DC/NY power and wealth hungry addicted and controlling egos that I try so hard to resist. Today I quit 3 social media networks, dropped 3 projects that no longer made sense, and am deciding to double down on what I believe is authentic to my nature and being, that will continue to serve me well personally and professionally in my work. Thank you so much for helping me verbally process, grow, raise hard and contentious questions and receive so many more resources and feedback I am still processing I feel like I did 5 MOOCs and a degrrr in Kernel it was far more than I expected than a YC, graduate degree, or self-help coaching session. This has been powerful for me as a community organizer, entrepreneur, software engineer, computational designer, as a woman of color, colonized person, and avid reader. I so appreciate all the hard work it takes to create content, organize logistics, moderate, facilitate, and maintain as a steward and also much love to every single person in the Kernel community who has been responsive with every chat, every request, and every ask I have made whether verbal, written or otherwise. I am constantly amazed by this community and am so privileged to be a part of it. It's been an honor to be selected as a fellow and I can only hope I live up to what I set out to do next now with a framework that helps heal me and keep me grounded away from a hamster wheel that is life. I am taking a major cooling period after December and hope to share more work come 2022 with Kernel (maybe a future showcase), of all that's been incubating and cooking up in my head, behind Code editors and things I haven't pushed to GitHub, announced or made live yet. Lastly, thank you @Kevin Owocki for founding GitCoin, seeing you speak at Dystopia Labs and other conferences over the years always impressed me and I'm floored to have participated somehow in some small way related remotely to the work that you do, it is so important for the liberation of all people in the world and I hope that it continues to evolve with each Kernel block in the future.

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

attributes.value: Heartverse

All this life
to learn one true verse:

Thank you.

Thank you, thank you, thank you.

25329705706577196.name: Rich Blundell
25329705706577196.testimonial:
The great rain animals returned
this season, cascading
over our flimsy dam wall
and willing this old river
back into the ocean,
washing clean away
the great sand bar that has, 
for so long, separated them.

The cattle egrets step back
into soft Cintsa mud
celebrating the touch of sun
so dimly remembered after endless
cycles of silt and sadness.

Sing my heart, this beauty
has already saved the world
and will again, over and over:
life is the healing
for which we are here.

I am so thankful!

Wow, is all I can say. I didn’t know what to expect coming in, other than Kernel came highly recommended from a friend who’s worked in crypto for years. I’m amazed by all of the incredible, talented, warm, and kind people here. I feel that I’ve only scratched the surface of meeting people and going deeper into the conversations this has sparked. Thanks so much to @cryptowanderer @Vivek Singh and the team for curating such a transformational experience. I also appreciate folks like @johnx25bd @alisha @Vivek Singh as mentors for generously giving your time on calls! Wonderful to have calls with @Michael Keating @snax y-not @Matthew Scott Jones @Denise Schaefer and have great junto conversations with folks like @Renee Maria Lee @Divine Artis @Jake Becker @Ela + participating in the Declaration of Interdependence with @Jasmine Wang and the climate lightning talks with @Vienna Looi!

Here’s to this only being the beginning! I’m looking forward to transitioning full time into web3 projects and startups and I’m looking forward to collaborating with you all. :kernel-love:

Thank you <!subteam^S01JV5JPV6E|@kernel-stewards> and all the people I met along the way for this amazing journey.

:sunny: I started KERNEL very hopeful, thinking I had found likeminded people, a community to learn, to build, and to be myself and not have to explain context before saying something.

:partly_sunny_rain: Then I realized how wrong I was! I would be asking myself "WTF are they talking about?" during fireside chats or random juntos; I'd get frustrated with how (maybe intentionally) unclear KERNEL is (you have to create your own adventure, of which KERNEL is a tool... I guess); I'd get a little jealous seeing all the people saying thank you on this channel, feeling "should I be doing more to get as enthusiastic and happy as them?"; and just generally anxious for not having enough time to be with my family, do my full-time job (not for long), work on the next adventure, and also read and watch all the curated material.

I'm not gonna lie, I still have those negative (complementary opposing) feelings... at least sometimes :slightly_smiling_face:.

:mostly_sunny:But then I realized people and groups don't (necessarily) care about my expectations. I really understood and appreciated the "group with loosely shared interests" description of the fellows. I started to find new language to express my ideas, to communicate better, and to just appreciate those conflicting feelings, because they moved me to action. I found myself having more conversations and asking better questions (initially just to myself). And finally, thanks to a conversation with @Sarah Hamburg, who wisely said "KERNEL is a marathon, not a sprint" (Thanks for that, Sarah!), I started to think more long-term.

:kernel-love: Thank you for igniting this in me. From this inner turmoil, love-hate relationship, that KERNEL has been, a new (hopefully better) Guillermo emerges.
I look forward to more adventures together and continue to obsessively check this slack in the future (I struggle to control my FOMO). Thanks @Sarah Hamburg @Holly Grimm @Saskia Westhof @Aimara Garcia Cabezas @Greg Becker @Ray Di Felice @snax y-not @Tim Courtney for amazing conversations.

Finally, the whole theme of KERNEL reminded me of <https://sites.evergreen.edu/politicalshakespeares/wp-content/uploads/sites/226/2015/12/Borges-Tl%C3%B6n-Uqbar-Orbius-Tertius.pdf|"Tlon, Uqbar, Orbis Tertius">, by my favorite author Jorge Luis Borges. Check it out.
> "Then English and French and mere Spanish will disappear from the globe. The world will be Tlon."

I couldn’t let this experience end without sending some love to the KB4 community. Kernel has been an amazing journey and I think the best part is that it feels like the start of an even richer adventure. I’ve had some incredible conversations over the past 8 weeks, but wanted to say a special thanks to a few people:
• @Jasmine Wang for an intellectual brunch that opened up a number of new paths for me :sailboat: 
• @Michael Zargham for helping me sift through the noise and zero in on where I want to focus :dart: 
• @cryptowanderer for (per usual) providing a level-headed perspective on this world :male_mage: 
• @snax y-not for riffing on food, fun, and the future of franchises :pizza: 
• @Michael Keating for comparing notes in the early days and spearheading the tokenomics guild :scales: 
• my ~girlfriend~ fiance for providing endless support and agreeing to marry me back in week 3 :ring: 
I’m gutted to miss the final session today (will be traveling :disappointed:), but I take solace in the fact that I’ll see you all out in the garden very soon :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you @Michael Keating for todays office hours talk. I really appreciate everything you've said to me today, all your questions, advices that you've given me. All of them will help me clarify more what I want and what I will do in a near future. Also thanks to @Amarnath Jayanti @sidcode @snax y-not for listening to my story and giving me your advice. I really needed to hear that. And thanks @Vivek Singh for connecting me with Michael. Kernel is such a great community :kernel-love:

@Songyi Lee @Tim Courtney @snax y-not all for points on curation vs. volume discussion and thoughts on DAOs modeled as libraries / supportive of different personal hobbies. Tim shared this in conjunction with the topic of Gore having innovation in democracy: <https://www.managementexchange.com/story/innovation-democracy-wl-gores-original-management-model#:~:text=As%20Gore%20has%[>…]no%20management%20layers @sumedha for organizing
